metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4927 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: Buffer overflow in ACME micro_httpd, as used in D-Link DSL2750U and DSL2740U and NetGear WGR614 and MR-ADSL-DG834 routers allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a long string in the URI in a GET request.

notes.Note: seth-arnold> No source control or issue tracker for micro-httpd

criterions.comment: micro-httpd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
